subject: Law
title: Access to Justice and Legal Aid
description: A micro-lesson that makes Access to Justice and Legal Aid usable.

hook.text: A single mother faces eviction. She can't afford a lawyer. In civil court, she has no right to one. She loses.

buildup.text: The justice gap means millions can't afford legal help. 86% of civil legal problems for low-income people go unmet.

discovery.text: Legal aid organizations provide free help, but they're chronically underfunded and can serve only a fraction of need.

twist.text: Unlike criminal cases, there's no right to a lawyer in civil matters‚Äîeven when housing, custody, or safety is at stake.

climax.text: Pro bono work, legal tech, and self-help resources are expanding access‚Äîbut can't close the gap alone.

punchline.text: Justice for all requires lawyers for all. We're nowhere close.
